Class GeneratedFunction.Builder<I,O>

java.lang.Object
functions.GeneratedFunction.Builder<I,O>
Type Parameters:
I - the input type
O - the output type
Enclosing class:
GeneratedFunction<I,O>
public static class GeneratedFunction.Builder<I,O> extends Object
A builder for creating generated functions using descriptions, scenarios, test classes, or custom strategies.

This class provides a fluent interface for incrementally configuring the parameters of a GeneratedFunction and creating it using the build() method.

    • build

      public GeneratedFunction<I,O> build()
      Builds and returns a GeneratedFunction using the configured parameters.
      Returns:
      a GeneratedFunction<I, O> instance
      Throws:
      ConfigurationException - if required parameters are missing or invalid

    • withInputValidation

      public GeneratedFunction.Builder<I,O> withInputValidation(ErrorCondition<I> errorCondition)
      Adds a single error condition to the function generator.

      The provided ErrorCondition includes a predicate that will be evaluated before the function body is executed. If the predicate evaluates to true, the specified exception will be thrown immediately, causing the function to fail early.

      Early Failure Example:

      
 // Define an error condition that checks for null input
 ErrorCondition<String> nullCheck = new ErrorCondition<>(
         NullPointerException.class,
         input -> input == null,
         "Input cannot be null");

 // Build the function generator with the error condition
 GeneratedFunction<String, Integer> generator = GeneratedFunction.<String, Integer>builder()
         .withDescription("Parses an integer from a string")
         .withInputType(String.class)
         .withOutputType(Integer.class)
         .withStrategy(strategy)
         .withInputValidation(nullCheck);

 // When invoking the function with null input, the predicate triggers
 // early failure
 try {
     Integer result = generator.build().invoke(null);
 } catch (NullPointerException e) {
     System.out.println(e.getMessage()); // Output: Input cannot be null
 }
      Parameters:
      errorCondition - the error condition to add
      Returns:
      this builder instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if errorCondition is null

    • withInputValidations

      public GeneratedFunction.Builder<I,O> withInputValidations(List<ErrorCondition<I>> errorConditions)
      Adds multiple error conditions to the function generator.

      All provided ErrorConditions include predicates that will be evaluated before the function body is executed. If any predicate evaluates to true, the corresponding exception will be thrown immediately, causing the function to fail early.

      Early Failure with Multiple Conditions:

      
 // Define multiple error conditions
 List<ErrorCondition<String>> conditions = Arrays.asList(
         new ErrorCondition<>(
                 IllegalArgumentException.class,
                 input -> input.isEmpty(),
                 "Input cannot be empty"),
         new ErrorCondition<>(
                 NumberFormatException.class,
                 input -> !input.matches("\\d+"),
                 "Input must be a numeric string"));

 // Build the function generator with the list of error conditions
 GeneratedFunction<String, Integer> generator = GeneratedFunction.<String, Integer>builder()
         .withDescription("Parses an integer from a numeric string")
         .withInputType(String.class)
         .withOutputType(Integer.class)
         .withStrategy(strategy)
         .withInputValidations(conditions);

 // Invoking with invalid input triggers early failure
 try {
     Integer result = generator.build().invoke("abc");
 } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
     System.out.println(e.getMessage()); // Output: Input must be a numeric string
 }
      Parameters:
      errorConditions - the list of error conditions to add
      Returns:
      this builder instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if errorConditions is null or contains null elements

    • withError

      public GeneratedFunction.Builder<I,O> withError(String conditionDescription, Class<? extends Exception> exceptionClass, String errorMessage)
      Adds an error condition to the function generator using a condition description, exception class, and error message.

      Unlike predicates provided in withInputValidation methods, the condition described here is intended to be interpreted and enforced by the AI model during or after the function execution. This means that the function will fail later, as the AI model processes the input and identifies the condition described in natural language.

      Late Failure Example:

      
 // Build the function generator with an AI-interpreted error condition
 GeneratedFunction<String, String> generator = GeneratedFunction.<String, String>builder()
         .withDescription("Converts a string to uppercase")
         .withInputType(String.class)
         .withOutputType(String.class)
         .withStrategy(strategy)
         .withError(
                 "Input string contains prohibited words",
                 IllegalArgumentException.class,
                 "Input contains prohibited content");

 // When invoking the function, the AI model will process the input and
 // may throw the exception
 try {
     String result = generator.build().invoke("This is a badword");
 } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
     System.out.println(e.getMessage()); // Output: Input contains prohibited content
 }

      Note: Since the condition is interpreted by the AI model, it depends on the model's understanding and processing of the input. The failure occurs during or after the function execution, not before.

      Parameters:
      conditionDescription - a description of the condition under which the exception should be thrown
      exceptionClass - the class of exception to throw when the condition is met
      errorMessage - the message to include in the exception when the condition is met
      Returns:
      this builder instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null
